description: The dissertation allows students to consolidate and extend the knowledge and skills acquired during the coursework and apply these in a practical way in a public health setting. It can form the basis of a paper publishable in a major public health journal. Before enrolling students must obtain permission from the program coordinator and achieved a minimum GPA of 5.5 across at least 8 units of coursework, including at least 4 units from Part A. Students completing dissertations are unlikely to have their degree conferred until the end of the semester following submission of their dissertation.
prerequisites: 8 units of Part A coursework with a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 5.5 over these courses.
